page.title: 01PARKHAM: AN OVERVIEW
page.content: In our block there is a village called Parkham. There are also a number of hamlets: Newhaven, Nethercott, Bocombe, Broad Parkham, Parkham Ash and Goldworthy. The population of the block is approximately 250. Most of the land is used for farming: eighteen farmers work in the area. They are nearly all dairy farmers, but most of them also keep sheep. Part of the land is used by the forestry commision.They grow fir trees which are used for the wood pulp industry. The steep sided valleys are also wooded broadleaved, hardwood trees. The landscape of our area is dominated by the farmland, forest and the steep sided valleys. The main centre of population is the village of Parkham.
